oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Iroquois Steeplechase at Percy Warner Park, Nashville, Tennessee, 1962 June 05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scene from the June 5th, 1962 Iroquois Steeplechase held at Percy Warner Park in Nashville, Tennessee. One of the oldest steeplechases in the country, the Iroquois Steeplechase race was inaugurated in 1941, and has been held annually, except in 1945, due to World War II. Named for Iroquois, the first American-bred Thoroughbred to win the prestigious British Epsom Derby. The race is three miles long, and includes a signature parade of foxhounds. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 35 mm color slide.
